Description: Biconical pottery vase of Nile silt clay with rounded base, exterior coated with red slip, burnished and decorated in thick yellow-white-paint with six roughly-made cross-hatched triangles arranged around the upper body. There is a white line around the mouth; the interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: It is probable (but cannot now be confirmed with certainty) that Mr. Legge, the donor of this and other objects, which he presented to the Museum in 1910, received them from the excavations of Ayrton and Loat at Mahasna in 1908-9, not those of Garstang at the same place in 1900-1. Legge worked at nearby Abydos in the same year in which Ayrton and Loat worked in the Predynastic cemetery at Mahasna (see 'Egypt Exploration Fund Arch. Report, 1908-9', 2, 5 ff.).
